intro: Aphora catamarcensis, commonly known as the Catamarcensis Aphora, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Argentina. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are pale yellow to white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
